intro: Thapsia polygama var. tenuisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thapsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
